doc.after: Several anecdotal stories supposedly explain why Warhol chose Campbell's Soup cans as the focal point of his pop art. One reason is that he needed a new subject after he abandoned comic strips, a move taken in part due to his respect for the refined work of Roy Lichtenstein. According to Ted Careyâone of Warhol's commercial art assistants in the late 1950sâit was Muriel Latow who suggested the idea for both the soup cans and Warhol's early U.S. dollar paintings.[35]
